department.dept_long_name: Department of Romance Languages and Literatures

course.title: Documenting Spanish Modernity: A Survey of Spanish Literature and Culture from 1700
course.description: From philosophical essays to newspaper articles, from romantic tragedy to turn-of-the-century films, from early autobiography to dirty realism, from academic landscape painting to comic strips, this course will present a provocatively diverse set of documents that will help understand Spain's equivocal and frequently contested Modernity.
course.prerequisites: A score above 780 on the SAT II or the Harvard Placement test; a 50- or 60-level course in Spanish; or permission of course head.
